subject: RE: [junit] Dynamic Casting of HomeInterface
msgSnippet: The only way that I know to simulate dynamic casting is to use Method.invoke(...). The dumb part about Java is that the objects know what type they are at
messageBody:
The only way that I know to simulate dynamic casting is to use
Method.invoke(...). The dumb part about Java is that the objects know what
type they are at runtime. Casting is just for the benefit of the compiler.

We use this in Test Mentor a lot to support arbitrary specification of
remote objects and the tests to perform on them.
